CRI.reason: High CRI is essential for color-sensitive activities like drawing and learning objects.
CRI.recommendation: Use LEDs with CRI ≥90 in art and play zones.

CRI.reason: Poor color accuracy can impair visual development and reduce engagement.
CRI.recommendation: Avoid low-CRI fixtures; ensure color accuracy for young learners.

CCT.reason: Warm light creates a comforting and calm environment, supporting emotional security.
CCT.recommendation: Install warm-white LEDs in nurseries and playrooms.

CCT.reason: Cool light may overstimulate young children and disrupt rest patterns.
CCT.recommendation: Avoid cool CCT in preschool areas; use warmer tones instead.

Lux.reason: Ensures sufficient brightness for play without causing overstimulation.
Lux.recommendation: Use general lighting plus dimmable zones for naps and quiet time.

Lux.reason: Too dim lighting hinders visual growth and safe movement.
Lux.recommendation: Maintain minimum lighting of 300 lux in active areas.

UGR.reason: Minimizes visual discomfort for sensitive young eyes.
UGR.recommendation: Use fixtures with diffusers and avoid direct beam paths.

UGR.reason: High glare increases distraction and may affect behavior.
UGR.recommendation: Use matte surfaces and indirect light fixtures.

Flicker.reason: Flicker-free lighting prevents headaches and overstimulation in sensitive young children.
Flicker.recommendation: Use flicker-free LED drivers, especially in special needs or nap zones.

Flicker.reason: Visible flicker can increase hyperactivity and discomfort.
Flicker.recommendation: Avoid budget LEDs with unstable drivers.

Uniformity.reason: Ensures even lighting across play and learning areas.
Uniformity.recommendation: Design layout with consistent lux across all child-accessible zones.

Melanopic_EDI.reason: Supports circadian rhythm alignment and sleep cycle stability.
Melanopic_EDI.recommendation: Use dynamic white lighting to match morning/day cycles.

Vertical_Illuminance.reason: Helps young children perceive facial cues and vertical surfaces.
Vertical_Illuminance.recommendation: Ensure soft uplight or wall washers to enhance facial recognition.

Exposure_Duration.recommendation: Use dimmable lighting with natural daylight rhythms.

CRI.reason: Acceptable for general classroom tasks but suboptimal for color-critical activities.
CRI.recommendation: Use CRI ≥90 in art, science, and craft zones.

CCT.reason: Neutral white light enhances focus and sustained attention.
CCT.recommendation: Use cool-neutral white in classrooms for academic performance.

Lux.reason: Promotes alertness and visibility during writing and reading tasks.
Lux.recommendation: Use uniform desk lighting and combine with daylight.

UGR.reason: Low glare prevents eye strain during long sessions.
UGR.recommendation: Ensure glare-controlled luminaires are used near screens and whiteboards.

Flicker.reason: Flicker-free lighting reduces visual fatigue and supports attention.

Uniformity.reason: Prevents contrast fatigue and supports reading across desks.
Uniformity.recommendation: Use indirect lighting and uplight portions for even light distribution.

Melanopic_EDI.reason: Boosts alertness and supports circadian entrainment in early school hours.
Melanopic_EDI.recommendation: Use cooler light in morning periods (e.g. 8–11 AM).

Vertical_Illuminance.reason: Improves visibility of whiteboards and teacher faces.
Vertical_Illuminance.recommendation: Install asymmetric fixtures for boards and vertical zones.

Exposure_Duration.reason: Well-distributed exposure improves attention span and mood.
Exposure_Duration.recommendation: Use tunable lighting to reduce fatigue by afternoon.

CRI.reason: Necessary for color-accurate work in labs and design tasks.
CRI.recommendation: Use high-CRI LEDs in technical rooms and study labs.

CCT.reason: Cool white supports cognitive alertness, especially during exams and screen use.
CCT.recommendation: Use tunable CCT systems to shift between exam, relax, and discussion modes.

CCT.reason: Warm tones can make students sleepy or unfocused during critical thinking tasks.
CCT.recommendation: Only use warmer tones in break zones or after-hours.

Lux.reason: Ensures sufficient brightness for visual comfort in academic tasks.
Lux.recommendation: Enhance light with task-specific LEDs in exams or digital work.

UGR.reason: Essential in screen-heavy environments to avoid digital eye strain.
UGR.recommendation: Combine low-glare LEDs with anti-reflective work surfaces.

Flicker.reason: Crucial for screen-based work to prevent migraines and reduce fatigue.
Flicker.recommendation: Use certified flicker-free lighting in digital classrooms and labs.

Uniformity.reason: Helps reduce contrast strain during high-focus tasks like exams.
Uniformity.recommendation: Uniform ceiling + task lighting is recommended.

Melanopic_EDI.reason: High melanopic content aligns with teen biological delays in melatonin cycles.
Melanopic_EDI.recommendation: Use blue-enriched morning light to support alertness.

Vertical_Illuminance.reason: Enhances visibility of facial expressions and writing surfaces in lecture settings.
Vertical_Illuminance.recommendation: Use adjustable wall washers and teacher spot lighting.

Exposure_Duration.reason: Extended exposure to high-quality light supports academic performance and cognitive rhythm.
Exposure_Duration.recommendation: Use dynamic CCT to mimic natural daylight cycle.
